poem:
"Rays on the Horizon"

Life, a canvas of routine shades,
Subtle as the Irish green, 
Friendship, a simple melody played,
in McGahern's rustic scene.
Squirely Joe, in quiet refrain,
Unveils the drama unseen.
In whispers of the mundane,
A poignant picture, serene.

For, even in the 'day-to-day',
In nuances of the wrung,
One finds hope's gentle sway,
against the rising sun.
